00045 #include <avr32/io.h>
00046 #include "compiler.h"
00047 #include "intc.h"
00048 #include "twi.h"

00050 
00052 static volatile avr32_twi_t *twi_inst1 = &AVR32_TWI;
00053 
00055 static char *twi_tx_data = NULL;
00057 static char *twi_rx_data = NULL;
00058 
00060 static int twi_tx_nb_bytes = 0;
00062 static int twi_rx_nb_bytes = 0;
00063 
00065 static unsigned long twi_it_mask;
00066 
00069 #if __GNUC__
00070 __attribute__((__interrupt__))
00071 #elif __ICCAVR32__
00072 __interrupt
00073 #endif
00074 static void twi_inst1_interrupt_handler(void)
00075 {
00076   // get masked status register value
00077   int status = twi_inst1->sr & twi_it_mask;
00078 
00079   // this is a NACK
00080   if (status & AVR32_TWI_SR_NACK_MASK)
00081   {
00082     goto nack;
00083   }
00084   // this is a RXRDY
00085   else if (status & AVR32_TWI_SR_RXRDY_MASK)
00086   {
00087     // get data from Receive Holding Register
00088     *twi_rx_data++ = twi_inst1->rhr;
00089     // last byte to receive
00090     if(--twi_rx_nb_bytes==1)
00091     {
00092       // set stop bit
00093       twi_inst1->cr = AVR32_TWI_STOP_MASK;
00094     }
00095     // receive complete
00096     if (twi_rx_nb_bytes==0)
00097     {
00098       // finish the receive operation
00099       goto complete;
00100     }
00101   }
00102   // this is a TXRDY
00103   else if (status & AVR32_TWI_SR_TXRDY_MASK)
00104   {
00105     // decrease transmited bytes number
00106     twi_tx_nb_bytes--;
00107     // no more bytes to transmit
00108     if (twi_tx_nb_bytes <= 0)
00109     {
00110       // enable TXCOMP IT and unmask all others IT
00111       twi_it_mask = AVR32_TWI_IER_TXCOMP_MASK;
00112       twi_inst1->ier = twi_it_mask;
00113     }
00114     else
00115     {
00116       // put the byte in the Transmit Holding Register
00117       twi_inst1->thr = (unsigned long)*twi_tx_data++;
00118     }
00119   }
00120   // this is a TXCOMP
00121   else if (status & AVR32_TWI_SR_TXCOMP_MASK)
00122   {
00123     // finish the transmit operation
00124     goto complete;
00125   }
00126 
00127   return;
00128 
00129 nack:
00130   // add some code here if you want to handle NACK operations
00131 complete:
00132   // disable all interrupts
00133   twi_disable_interrupt(twi_inst1);
00134 
00135   return;
00136 }

00147 static int twi_set_speed(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi, unsigned int speed, unsigned long pba_hz)
00148 {
00149   unsigned int cldiv;
00150   unsigned int ckdiv = 0;
00151 
00152   cldiv = (pba_hz / speed) - 4;
00153 
00154   // cldiv must fit in 8 bits, ckdiv must fit in 3 bits
00155   while ((cldiv > 0xFF) && (ckdiv < 0x7))
00156   {
00157     // increase clock divider
00158     ckdiv++;
00159     // divide cldiv value
00160     cldiv /= 2;
00161   }
00162   // set clock waveform generator register
00163   twi->cwgr = ( cldiv | (cldiv << AVR32_TWI_CWGR_CHDIV_OFFSET) | (ckdiv << AVR32_TWI_CWGR_CKDIV_OFFSET) );
00164 
00165   return TWI_SUCCESS;
00166 }
00167 
00168 int twi_init(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi, const twi_options_t *opt)
00169 {
00170   int status;
00171 
00172   // Disable TWI interrupts
00173   twi->idr = ~0UL;
00174 
00175   // Reset TWI
00176   twi->cr = AVR32_TWI_CR_SWRST_MASK;
00177 
00178   // Dummy read in SR
00179   status = twi->sr;
00180 
00181   // Disable all interrupts
00182   Disable_global_interrupt();
00183 
00184   // Register TWI handler on level 2
00185   INTC_register_interrupt( &twi_inst1_interrupt_handler, AVR32_TWI_IRQ, INT2);
00186 
00187   // Enable all interrupts
00188   Enable_global_interrupt();
00189 
00190   // Select the speed
00191   twi_set_speed(twi, opt->speed, opt->pba_hz);
00192 
00193   // Probe the component
00194   status = twi_probe(twi, opt->chip) ;
00195 
00196   return status;
00197 }
00198 
00199 void twi_disable_interrupt(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi)
00200 {
00201   twi->idr = ~0UL;
00202 }
00203 
00204 int twi_probe(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi, char chip_addr)
00205 {
00206   twi_package_t package;
00207   char data[1] = {0};
00208 
00209   // data to send
00210   package.buffer = data;
00211   // chip address
00212   package.chip = chip_addr;
00213   // frame length
00214   package.length = 1;
00215   // address length
00216   package.addr_length = 0;
00217   // internal chip address
00218   package.addr = 0;
00219   // perform a master write access
00220   return (twi_master_write(twi, &package));
00221 }
00222 
00223 int twi_master_read(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi, const twi_package_t *package)
00224 {
00225   int rx_timeout;
00226 
00227   // check argument
00228   if (package->length == 0)
00229   {
00230     return TWI_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00231   }
00232 
00233   // set read mode, slave address and 3 internal address byte length
00234   twi->mmr = (package->chip << AVR32_TWI_MMR_DADR_OFFSET) |
00235              ((package->addr_length << AVR32_TWI_MMR_IADRSZ_OFFSET) & AVR32_TWI_MMR_IADRSZ_MASK) |
00236              (1 << AVR32_TWI_MMR_MREAD_OFFSET);
00237 
00238   // set internal address for remote chip
00239   twi->iadr = package->addr;
00240 
00241   // get a pointer to applicative data
00242   twi_rx_data = package->buffer;
00243 
00244   // get a copy of nb bytes to read
00245   twi_rx_nb_bytes = package->length;
00246 
00247   // Enable master transfer
00248   twi->cr =  AVR32_TWI_CR_MSEN_MASK;
00249 
00250   // Send start condition
00251   twi->cr = AVR32_TWI_START_MASK ;
00252 
00253   // only one byte to receive
00254   if(twi_rx_nb_bytes == 1)
00255   {
00256     // set stop bit
00257     twi->cr = AVR32_TWI_STOP_MASK;
00258   }    
00259 
00260   // mask NACK and RXRDY interrupts
00261   twi_it_mask = AVR32_TWI_IER_NACK_MASK | AVR32_TWI_IER_RXRDY_MASK;
00262 
00263   // update IMR through IER
00264   twi->ier = twi_it_mask;
00265 
00266   // setup timeout value
00267   rx_timeout = TWI_TIMEOUT * twi_rx_nb_bytes;
00268 
00269   // get data while timeout decrease
00270   while (twi_rx_nb_bytes && --rx_timeout);
00271 
00272   // Disable master transfer
00273   twi->cr =  AVR32_TWI_CR_MSDIS_MASK;
00274 
00275   // if timeout occurs
00276   if (rx_timeout == 0)
00277   {
00278     return TWI_TIMEOUT_ERR;
00279   }
00280 
00281   // everything is ok
00282   return TWI_SUCCESS;
00283 }
00284 
00285 int twi_master_write(volatile avr32_twi_t *twi, const twi_package_t *package)
00286 {
00287   int tx_timeout;
00288 
00289   // No data to send
00290   if (package->length == 0)
00291   {
00292     return TWI_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00293   }
00294 
00295   // Enable master transfer
00296   twi->cr =  AVR32_TWI_CR_MSEN_MASK;
00297 
00298   // set write mode, slave address and 3 internal address byte length
00299   twi->mmr = (0 << AVR32_TWI_MMR_MREAD_OFFSET) |
00300              (package->chip << AVR32_TWI_MMR_DADR_OFFSET) |
00301              ((package->addr_length << AVR32_TWI_MMR_IADRSZ_OFFSET) & AVR32_TWI_MMR_IADRSZ_MASK);
00302 
00303   // set internal address for remote chip
00304   twi->iadr = package->addr;
00305 
00306   // get a pointer to applicative data
00307   twi_tx_data = package->buffer;
00308 
00309   // get a copy of nb bytes to write
00310   twi_tx_nb_bytes = package->length;
00311 
00312   // put the first byte in the Transmit Holding Register
00313   twi_inst1->thr = (unsigned long)*twi_tx_data++;
00314 
00315   // mask NACK and TXRDY interrupts
00316   twi_it_mask = AVR32_TWI_IER_NACK_MASK | AVR32_TWI_IER_TXRDY_MASK;
00317 
00318   // update IMR through IER
00319   twi->ier = twi_it_mask;
00320 
00321   // setup timeout value
00322   tx_timeout = TWI_TIMEOUT * twi_tx_nb_bytes;
00323 
00324   // send data while timeout decrease
00325   while (twi_tx_nb_bytes && --tx_timeout);
00326 
00327   // Disable master transfer
00328   twi->cr =  AVR32_TWI_CR_MSDIS_MASK;
00329 
00330   // if timeout occurs
00331   if (tx_timeout == 0)
00332   {
00333     return TWI_TIMEOUT_ERR;
00334   }
00335 
00336   // Everything went ok
00337   return TWI_SUCCESS;
00338 }
